TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RadialGauge extends Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control

Docs.summary: A Modern UI Radial Gauge using XAML and Composition API. The scale of the gauge is a clockwise arc that sweeps from MinAngle (default lower left, at -150°) to MaxAngle (default lower right, at +150°).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Create a default radial gauge control.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control accepts setting its value through interaction.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Windows.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty IsInteractiveProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the property.
Gets or sets the end angle of the scale, which corresponds with the Maximum value, in degrees.
Docs.remarks: Changing MaxAngle may require retemplating the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Windows.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty MaxAngleProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the MaxAngle dependency property.
Gets or sets the maximum value of the scale.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Windows.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty MaximumProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the Maximum dependency property.
Gets or sets the start angle of the scale, which corresponds with the Minimum value, in degrees.
Docs.remarks: Changing MinAngle may require retemplating the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Windows.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty MinAngleProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the MinAngle dependency property.
Gets or sets the minimum value of the scale.

Gets or sets the needle brush.

Gets or sets the needle width, in percentage of the gauge radius.

Docs.summary: Identifies the NeedleWidth dependency property.
Gets the normalized maximum angle.
Docs.value: The maximum angle, in the range from -180 to 540.

Docs.summary: Gets the normalized minimum angle.
Docs.value: The minimum angle in the range from -180 to 180.
